precontext: Lily was sitting by the pond, listening to the gentle rustling of the leaves. She had been visiting this spot every day, hoping to see some wildlife. A frog appeared on a rock, looking still and mysterious.
ending: It was a warning of what was to come next: a storm where the wildlife died.
meanings_considered: pass from physical life and lose all bodily attributes and functions necessary to sustain life
utter a hoarse sound, like a raven
explanation:
• The frog making a hoarse sound like a raven is a plausible and biologically accurate behavior for a frog croaking in a natural setting.  
• The meaning of "pass from physical life" is implausible here because the frog is actively present and described as "looking still and mysterious," not dying or ceasing to exist.  
• The precontext and ending both support a literal, biological interpretation of "croak" as a sound, with the storm and wildlife dying being a consequence of the sound as a warning, not the frog's death.
clear_meaning_text: utter a hoarse sound, like a raven
